alert.note: Alert for Alleghany (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 5:59PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall that occurred early this morning is expected. * WHERE...Along the Cowpasture River and associated tributaries in Alleghany County, VA. * WHEN...Until 945 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas along the Cowpasture River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 552 PM EST, Automated river gauges indicate that the Cowpasture River is continuing to rise this evening, which may result in minor flooding of lowland areas. The river is expected to crest by 8 pm, and will recede through the remainder of the night. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Sinking Creek, Wilson Creek and Pads Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Longdale Furnace...
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding, and do not drive on flooded roads. Please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
